newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - July 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - July 9.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The British frigate HMS Westminster will be berthing in the capital Abu Dhabi for four days after patrolling the northern Arabian Gulf as part of the international fleet enforcing U.N. sanctions.
- Dubai Duty Free said its 1997 first half sales reached 345 million dirhams ($92 million), up by 21 million dirhams over the same period of 1996.
- The Emirates Telecommunications Corporation (Etisalat) is to be the official sponsor of the Internet World Middle East Exhibition and Conference, to be held in Abu Dhabi in February.
- Gold shops in Dubai are witnessing a surge in sales but retailers and wholesalers are reluctant to attribute it wholly to the sinking prices of gold on the international market.
- Preliminary UAE Central Bank figures show that higher oil prices had a positive effect on national output and government finances during 1996.
